revised_title: The Mental Lexicon: Components and Interrelations of Lexical Codes
tldr: This article investigates the components of the mental lexicon and their interrelations, focusing on the functional independence of non-linguistic cognitive representations and word-specific lexical codes in phonological and orthographic forms. The authors analyze language performance in brain-damaged patients to understand how different aspects of language are processed and how they communicate with each other. The study concludes that there is a modular organization of the nervous system, with distinct channels of communication between independent components of the mental lexicon.
